section.heading: Introduction to XML
section.paragraph: XML (eXtensible Markup Language) is a markup language that defines a set of rules for encoding documents in a format that is both human-readable and machine-readable. It is widely used for data storage, configuration files, and data exchange between systems.

list.item: Supports validation through DTD or XSD

section.heading: Common Use Cases
section.paragraph: XML is commonly used for configuration files, data exchange formats, web services (SOAP), document storage, and as a foundation for other markup languages like XHTML and SVG.
